long: Meaning: properly, a "mortal" (and thus differing from the more dignified "H120"); hence, a "man" in general (singly or collectively).  Usage: another, × (blood-) thirsty, certain, chap(-man); divers, fellow, × in the flower of their age, husband, (certain, mortal) man, people, person, servant, some (× of them),   stranger, those,   their trade. It is often unexpressed in the English versions, especially when used in apposition with another word. Compare "H376".  Source: from "H605";
